meanings.definition: To negotiate a better deal than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outbargained her friend to get the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: He always outbargained the other vendors at the market.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbargained the dog for the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox outbargained the sly wolf in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The student outbargained the teacher for extra credit points.

meanings.definition: To be more successful in bargaining than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The team outbargained their opponents to win the championship.
meanings.sent2: She outbargained her siblings to get the biggest slice of cake.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outbargained her parents for a later bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The detective outbargained the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent5: The farmer outbargained the salesman to get a better price for his crops.
